text: The Senior or Staff Statistical Analyst contributes to the analysis of clinical study data through their statistical programming expertise. This individual will develop programs for and maintain complete and auditable documentation of the analysis of clinical studies.

li: Provide statistical programming support to pre-defined and exploratory analysis, formal reports, publications, presentations, and new statistical methodologies
li.1: Work closely with biostatisticians to create data and analysis program specifications based on the statistical analysis plan (SAP)
li.2: Maintain complete and auditable programming documentation for analysis of clinical studies
li.3: Contribute to the development, documentation and maintenance of a reusable programming code library
li.4: Serve as a member of clinical study teams
li.5: Have opportunities to work with data scientists closely on machine learning projects
li.6: Have opportunities to work on engineering-oriented projects like dashboarding and scaling up efforts with large-scale genomic data
li.7: May have opportunities to act as a biostatistician on small-scale projects
li.8: Stay abreast of industry developments in the Statistical Programming field and apply to appropriate systems and processes

li: 5+ years statistical programming experience in academia or industry. Molecular diagnostics industry experience preferred
li.1: 2+ years of experience will be considered for senior level
li.2: B.S. or M.S in Statistics or related field
li.3: Proficient in R or Python or SAS
li.4: Knowledge of applicable regulatory rules and guidelines, e.g., ICH, GCP, HIPAA
li.5: Ability to work independently on multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment
li.6: Strong team player with demonstrated track record of success in cross-functional team environment
